problem.title: Isomorphic Strings
problem.description:
Given two strings s and t, determine if they are isomorphic.

Two strings s and t are isomorphic if the characters in s can be replaced to get t.

All occurrences of a character must be replaced with another character while preserving the order of characters. No two characters may map to the same character, but a character may map to itself.
constraints: s and t consist of any valid ascii character.

examples.explanation: In this case, 'e' can be replaced by 'a' and 'g' can be replaced by 'd'.
No two letters may map to the same letter, so 'o' cannot be mapped to both 'a' and 'r'.
In this case, 'p' can be replaced by 't', 'a' can be replaced by 'i', 'e' can be replaced by 'l', and 'r' can be replaced by 'e'.

functionSignature.typescript:
function isIsomorphic(s: string, t: string): boolean { 

};
functionSignature.python: def isIsomorphic(s: str, t: str) -> bool:

sampleTestCases.description: Basic test case: isomorphic strings with a simple mapping.
Basic test case: non-isomorphic strings where one character maps to two different characters.

hiddenTestCases.description: Basic test case: isomorphic strings with character mapping to itself.
Complex case: strings with repeating patterns that are isomorphic.
Complex case: strings where one string has repeating characters and the other doesn't, making them non-isomorphic.
Complex case: Long strings that are isomorphic.
Complex case: strings with some identical characters but ultimately not isomorphic.
Edge case: strings where all characters are the same.
Complex case: near isomorphic strings that differ only in one character mapping.
